item.title: Haskell troubleshooting
item.description: Can’t find module which exists and is in the same directory source code https://github.com/ThomasZumsteg/exercism-haskell/blob/master/say/say%5Ftest.hs Asked on #haskell 16:19 < libertyprime> having trouble getting this to run https://asciinema.org/a/Z7G0B7ZmNtwjcnSSylEAWpUaI https://github.com/ThomasZumsteg/exercism-haskell/blob/master/say/say_test.hs 16:19 < libertyprime> not sure why 16:19 < libertyprime> the module is defined in say.hs in the same directory as say_test.hs 16:20 < Axman6> you probably want Say.hs 16:20 ::: Join to #haskell was synced in 378 secs 16:23 < libertyprime> thanks axman.

item.title: (WIP) Syntax transformers step by step
item.description: Demonstrate monad transformers Build an interpreter for the little language below. type Name = String -- variable names data Exp = Lit Integer -- expressions | Var Name | Plus Exp Exp | Abs Name Exp | App Exp Exp deriving (Show) data Value = IntVal Integer -- values | FunVal Env Name Exp deriving (Show) type Env = Map.Map Name Value -- mapping from names to values Add the header module Transformers where import Control.

item.title: Fused effects
item.description: Original video “Building Haskell Programs with Fused Effects” by Patrick Thomson - YouTube Part of the GitHub semantic code team. Install fused-effects stack install fused-effects Slides fused-effects is a library for building Haskell programs an effect system providing fused, scoped, higher-order algebraic effects. performant, production-quality software suitable for industrial use. Today, we’ll… describe the status quo of building Haskell programs explore how this status quo can be limiting show how fused-effects can overcome these limitations pinpoint fused-effects’s position in the design space How are we to build programs in Haskell?

item.title: Learning Haskell
item.description: Start with haskellbook.com and avoid learn you a haskell. Reading Monad transformers step-by-step https://page.mi.fu-berlin.de/scravy/realworldhaskell/materialien/monad-transformers-step-by-step.pdf $DUMP$NOTES/ws/haskell/reading/monad-transformers-step-by-step.txt Module Data.Maybe Defines useful functions for dealing with optional values of type Maybe a. Module Data.Map Defines finite maps. Basic monads https://wiki.haskell.org/All%5FAbout%5FMonads 2.2 The Identity monad 2.3 The Maybe monad 2.4 The Error monad 2.5 The List monad 2.6 The IO monad 2.7 The State monad 2.8 The Reader monad 2.9 The Writer monad 2.
